clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Clinical and Laboratory Findings and Diuretic Efficacy in Patients With Edematous States in the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Clinical and Laboratory Findings and Diuretic Efficacy in Patients With Edematous States in the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is the characterization of parameters from medical history, physical examination and diagnostics, which correlate with and could be used to predict diuretic efficacy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This prospective observational study is conducted to identify and further isolate possible predictors for the efficacy of diuretics and to identify potential new predictors.
The study also observes if specific diuretic regimes (e.g. combination of loop diuretics and distal effective diuretics for sequential nephron blockade) have a greater diuretic effect. This is not yet proved.
The data of the study shall to help to determine criteria, allowing to choose an effective diuretic regime in different patient cohorts already at the beginning of therapy and to identify patients at high risk.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the emergency department until 24 hours after the first diuretic administration
primary_outcome.description: Multivariate regression analysis with independent variables, such as sequential nephron blockade, serum creatinine, serum urea, urine sodium. The dependent variable will be the difference in weight before diuretic administration and 24 hours afterwards

primary_outcome.measure: Multivariate regression analysis 24 hours time course
primary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the emergency department until 24 hours after first diuretic administration
primary_outcome.description: Multivariate regression analysis with independent variables, such as sequential nephron blockade, serum creatinine, serum urea, urine sodium. The dependent variables will be the difference in weight before and after diuretic administration at different times (e.g. 6h, 18h) within in the first 24 hours after first diuretic administration

arm_group.description: Patients with edematous states receive standard of care diuretic.

intervention.intervention_name: Characterization of parameters of medical history, examination and diagnostics.
intervention.description: Patients receive standard of care diuretics. The study only collects data to characterize parameters of medical history, examination and diagnostics.

study_pop.textblock: Inclusion of patients with edematous states of cardiac or renal genesis. Patients with liver cirrhosis and in need of ascites puncture and/or thoracentesis are excluded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age over 18 years.
- Edema (peripheral and/or pulmonal) of cardiac or renal genesis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Persons who are in a dependency/employment relationship with the investigators.
- Accommodation in an institution by judicial or administrative order.
- Patients in need of ascites puncture and/or thoracentesis on admission day.
